titleStmt.title: The Kings medicines for the plague prescribed for the yeare 1604. by the whole Colledge of Physitians, both spirituall and temporall. And now most fitting for this dangerous time of infection, to be used all England over.
titleStmt.author: Royal College of Physicians of London.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Gosson, and are to be sold by F. Coules, at his shop in the upper end of the Old Bayly neere Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in the upper end of the Old Bayly neere Newgate
